meanings.definition: The land next to the sea; seashore.
meanings.sent1: We had a picnic on the coasts and watched the waves.
meanings.sent2: The children built sandcastles on the coasts during their beach vacation.
meanings.sent3: The seagulls danced along the coasts, looking for tasty snacks.
meanings.sent4: The sun sets gently over the coasts, painting the sky in hues of orange and pink.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the waves crashing against the coasts is soothing and calming.

meanings.definition: To move along or near the coast.
meanings.sent1: The ship coasts smoothly along the calm waters.
meanings.sent2: The joggers coasted along the scenic route by the coasts.
meanings.sent3: The skateboarder decided to coast down the hill towards the coasts for an adrenaline rush.
meanings.sent4: The car coasted effortlessly along the winding road next to the coasts.
meanings.sent5: The cyclist loves to coast leisurely by the coasts, enjoying the fresh sea breeze.

meanings.sent1: The sailors coasted past the lighthouse towards the beautiful coasts.
meanings.sent2: The yacht coasted gracefully along the shimmering waters near the coasts.
meanings.sent3: The pirates planned to coast stealthily along the coast to reach their hidden treasure.
meanings.sent4: The cruise ship coasted slowly, allowing passengers to admire the stunning coasts.
meanings.sent5: The fishing boat coasted towards the bustling port near the coasts, ready to unload its catch.
